A top Republican lawmaker says he's considering a new way for Congress to challenge the president.

The fact that Senate Judiciary Committee Chairman Arlen Specter is even considering a lawsuit against President Bush, shows just how irked he is.

Specter has asked former Reagan administration official Bruce Fein to draft legislation that would let Congress sue the president.
Fein says the case would look just like any other lawsuit, except the trial would be the political equivalent of Godzilla versus King Kong.
The Congress, the United States Congress, would be the plaintiff, and they would file a complaint against the president seeking an injunction against refusing to enforce a law.
